Subjective: Neck spot, 2 wks. Started after shaving wound, thought wart. Now swollen, redder, scabs fall off. Itches. No pain. Possible insect bite reaction. Hx: ear abscess, warts elsewhere. FHx: paternal skin problems (sun-related, grandfather/uncles), not melanoma. No similar spots elsewhere. Worried about skin cancer (googled, saw 'frightening things,' 'serious form of skin cancer for elderly'). Request: wants it removed. Left knee pain x few mos, post-running, lingers for days, not severe. No impact on work/sleep mentioned for neck spot. No smoking/alcohol mentioned.
Objective: Neck: Raised spot, ~0.5cm, pinkish-red, slightly redder center. No scab currently visible. No lymphadenopathy. No other suspicious spots on neck. Vitals: Not mentioned.
Assessment: Neck lesion, etiology unclear. DDx: Pyogenic granuloma, atypical mole. R/o skin malignancy (patient concern). Left knee pain, likely musculoskeletal.
Plan: GP to take photo (w/ cm scale), send to dermatologist via e-consult. Pt to text own photo.
Follow-up: Pt to call GP Fri for derm advice. GP to attempt call Fri 12:00-13:30 (Pt prefers <10:00 or >15:00). Voicemail option available.
Discussed removal options: Freezing (Pt preference), surgical excision (w/ tissue analysis), scraping (w/ tissue analysis).
Left knee pain: Advised separate appointment due to time constraints.
